Docs.summary: Represents a shortcut that can be published via ShortcutManager.

Docs.summary: Return the target activity.

remarks.para: Return the target activity.
This has nothing to do with the activity that this shortcut will launch. Launcher apps should show the launcher icon for the returned activity alongside this shortcut.

Docs.summary: Shortcut has been restored from the previous device, but the publisher app on the current device is of a lower version.

Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.Intent[] GetIntents() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return the intent set with Builder#setIntents(Intent[]).

remarks.para: Return the intent set with Builder#setIntents(Intent[]).

Launcher apps cannot see the intents. If a ShortcutInfo is obtained via LauncherApps, then this method will always return null. Launchers can only start a shortcut intent with LauncherApps#startShortcut.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return whether a shortcut only contains "key" information only or not.

remarks.para:
Return whether a shortcut only contains "key" information only or not. If true, only the following fields are available.
  • #getId()
  • #getPackage()
  • #getActivity()
  • #getLastChangedTimestamp()
  • #isDynamic()
  • #isPinned()
  • #isDeclaredInManifest()
  • #isImmutable()
  • #isEnabled()
  • #getUserHandle()

For performance reasons, shortcuts passed to LauncherApps.Callback#onShortcutsChanged(String, List, UserHandle) as well as those returned from LauncherApps#getShortcuts(ShortcutQuery, UserHandle) while using the ShortcutQuery#FLAG_GET_KEY_FIELDS_ONLY option contain only key information.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the ID of a shortcut.

remarks.para: Returns the ID of a shortcut.
Shortcut IDs are unique within each publisher app and must be stable across devices so that shortcuts will still be valid when restored on a different device. See ShortcutManager for details.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the intent that is executed when the user selects this shortcut.

remarks.para: Returns the intent that is executed when the user selects this shortcut. If setIntents() was used, then return the last intent in the array.

Launcher apps cannot see the intent. If a ShortcutInfo is obtained via LauncherApps, then this method will always return null. Launchers can only start a shortcut intent with LauncherApps#startShortcut.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return whether a shortcut is cached.

remarks.para: Return whether a shortcut is cached.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return whether a shortcut is static; that is, whether a shortcut is published from AndroidManifest.

remarks.para: Return whether a shortcut is static; that is, whether a shortcut is published from AndroidManifest.xml. If true, the shortcut is also #isImmutable().

When an app is upgraded and a shortcut is no longer published from AndroidManifest.xml, this will be set to false. If the shortcut is not pinned, then it'll disappear. However, if it's pinned, it will still be visible, #isEnabled() will be false and #isImmutable() will be true.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return whether a shortcut is dynamic.

remarks.para: Return whether a shortcut is dynamic.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Returns false if a shortcut is disabled with ShortcutManager#disableShortcuts.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsExcludedFromSurfaces(int32 surface) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return true if the shortcut is excluded from specified surface.

remarks.para: Return true if the shortcut is excluded from specified surface.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return if a shortcut is immutable, in which case it cannot be modified with any of ShortcutManager APIs.

remarks.para: Return if a shortcut is immutable, in which case it cannot be modified with any of ShortcutManager APIs.

All static shortcuts are immutable. When a static shortcut is pinned and is then disabled because it doesn't appear in AndroidManifest.xml for a newer version of the app, #isDeclaredInManifest() returns false, but the shortcut is still immutable.
All shortcuts originally published via the ShortcutManager APIs are all mutable.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: "Rank" of a shortcut, which is a non-negative, sequential value that's unique for each #getActivity for each of the two types of shortcuts (static and dynamic).

remarks.para: "Rank" of a shortcut, which is a non-negative, sequential value that's unique for each #getActivity for each of the two types of shortcuts (static and dynamic).
Floating shortcuts, or shortcuts that are neither static nor dynamic, will all have rank 0, because they aren't sorted. See the ShortcutManager's class javadoc for details.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
